prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What are Stefan's true and genuine thoughts, feelings, and intentions towards me?

Please do not immediately assume that I'm looking for romantic inclinations. I am not certain what, if any, feelings exist, and what those feelings are deemed to be. That is the reason I have drawn up the chart, is to get a true determination. So, any biasing towards romantic inclination or otherwise should be removed, and ensure that this chart is interpreted fully and objectively to discern the true nature of Stefan's feelings, thoughts, and intentions.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a factual extraction of the horary chart data using established horary principles. This catalog includes all planetary positions, major aspects, patterns, and special features as provided:

• Fundamental Planetary Positions
 – Sun: 29° 58′ Aquarius
 – Moon: 4° 29′ Scorpio
 – Mercury: 7° 10′ Pisces
 – Venus: 8° 18′ Aries
 – Mars: 17° 13′ Cancer (retrograde)
 – Jupiter: 11° 36′ Gemini
 – Saturn: 19° 24′ Pisces
 – Uranus: 23° 24′ Taurus
 – Neptune: 28° 31′ Pisces
 – Pluto: 2° 35′ Aquarius
 – North Node: 28° 56′ Pisces (retrograde)
 – Chiron: 20° 7′ Aries

• House Placements (as provided)
 1. 1st House begins at 3° Capricorn (contains Pluto)
 2. 2nd House begins at 9° Aquarius (contains Sun, Mercury, and Saturn)
 3. 3rd House begins at 25° Pisces (contains Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron)
 4. 4th House begins at 28° Aries
 5. 5th House begins at 20° Taurus (contains Uranus)
 6. 6th House begins at 9° Gemini (contains Jupiter)
 7. 7th House begins at 3° Cancer (contains Mars)
 8. 8th House begins at 9° Leo
 9. 9th House begins at 25° Virgo
 10. 10th House begins at 28° Libra (contains Moon)
 11. 11th House begins at 20° Scorpio
 12. 12th House begins at 9° Sagittarius

• Major Aspects (with orb sizes in degrees)
 – MC Opposition IC: orb 0°
 – Neptune Conjunction North Node: orb 0°
 – Moon Sextile Ascendant: orb 1°
 – Sun Sextile IC: orb 1°
 – Sun Trine MC: orb 1°
 – Moon Square Pluto: orb 2°
 – Mars Trine Saturn: orb 2°
 – Venus Sextile Jupiter: orb 3°
 – Mars Square Chiron: orb 3°
 – Moon Trine Mercury: orb 3°
 – Pluto Sextile North Node: orb 4°
 – Saturn Sextile Uranus: orb 4°
 – Mercury Sextile Ascendant: orb 4°
 – Sun Sextile Ascendant: orb 4°
 – Pluto Square IC: orb 4°
 – Pluto Square MC: orb 4°
 – Mercury Square Jupiter: orb 4°
 – Ascendant Sextile MC: orb 5°
 – Uranus Sextile Neptune: orb 5°
 – Neptune Square Ascendant: orb 5°
 – Venus Square Ascendant: orb 5°
 – Ascendant Trine IC: orb 5°
 – Sun Trine Moon: orb 5°
 – Mars Sextile Uranus: orb 6°
 – Venus Sextile Pluto: orb 6°
 – Sun Square Uranus: orb 6°
 – Moon Opposition IC: orb 6°
 – Moon Conjunction MC: orb 6°
 – Chiron Opposition MC: orb 8°
 – Chiron Conjunction IC: orb 8°

• Chart Configurations and Patterns
 – T-Square:
  • Involving MC (28° Libra), Pluto (2° Aquarius), IC (28° Aries), and Moon (4° Scorpio)
 – Cradle:
  • Involving Moon (4° Scorpio), IC (28° Aries), Sun (29° Aquarius), Ascendant (3° Capricorn), and MC (28° Libra)

• Special Features and Additional Indicators
 – Moon Phase: Waning gibbous
 – Chart Shape: Bucket formation
 – Mode Emphasis: Cardinal mode is dominant among the inner planets
 – Hemisphere Emphasis: Majority of inner planets are located in the bottom hemisphere
 – Mars is descending (indicative of an inward-turning or reflective energy)
 – Angular Points:
  • Moon is positioned on the Midheaven (10th House)
  • Chiron and the IC occupy the Nadir region
 – Aspect Frequency: Sextile is the most frequent aspect (a total of 11)
 – Sun engages in 10 aspects
 – Neptune in Pisces is in its own sign (rulership)

This complete, objective catalog of chart data has been compiled from the provided information. Further analysis can now be conducted based solely on these data points.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you. Please proceed to next steps.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is the second-layer documentation for interpretative analysis. The following factors have been identified objectively, based solely on the chart data provided, and will be used for determining Stefan’s genuine thoughts, feelings, and intentions:

• 7th House & Mars in Cancer (retrograde):
 – The 7th House, which governs partnerships, is in Cancer and contains Mars.
 – Mars retrograde in Cancer suggests that Stefan’s forward assertiveness in relationships is turned inward.
 – There is an indication of defensive or hesitant energy regarding direct engagement, possibly due to past wounds or internal conflicts.

• Aspect Involving Mars:
 – Mars is in a trine with Saturn (orb 2°), providing a stabilizing influence and self-discipline.
 – Mars is also square Chiron (orb 3°), which highlights a sensitive or wounded aspect regarding assertive expression.

• Reliance on the T-Square Configuration:
 – The T-Square involves the MC (28° Libra), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and the IC (28° Aries), with the Moon (4° Scorpio) a key participant.
 – This indicates tension between public roles and personal, private dynamics.
 – Such a configuration can reflect a turbulent inner process where deep psychological transformation is involved.

• Moon on the Midheaven in Libra and Associated Aspects:
 – The Moon, positioned at 4° Scorpio on the Midheaven, suggests that emotional factors and public image are intertwined in Stefan’s mindset.
 – Its square to Pluto (orb 2°) reinforces a dynamic of intense, possibly disruptive, emotional undercurrents.

• Mercury and Communication:
 – Mercury in Pisces (7°10′) paired with its sextile to the Ascendant (orb 4°) indicates intuitive communication, though its square with Jupiter (orb 4°) cautions potential exaggeration or misinterpretation in his thought processes.
 – This combination may generate ambiguities in how his thoughts are mentally processed, adding layers to his genuine intentions.

• Venus and Romantic/Passion Influences:
 – Venus in Aries (8°18′) in the 3rd House (which governs communication) points to dynamic, energetic impulses.
 – The sextile between Venus and Jupiter (orb 3°) supports openness and optimism in relational expression, but this must be weighed against other indicators.

• Neptune, North Node, and Idealistic Influences:
 – Neptune in Pisces (28°31′) is in its own sign and closely conjoined with the North Node (28°56′), suggesting a strong drive toward idealism and heightened intuition that colors Stefan’s internal vision.
 – This aspect may bring elements of both illusion and refined sensitivity in his feelings.

• Cradle Pattern:
 – The Cradle pattern involving the Moon, IC, Sun, Ascendant, and MC implies supportive structural relationships in the chart.
 – This may indicate that despite inner tensions, there is an underlying alignment in his psychological and public self-presentation.

• Additional Notable Points:
 – The majority of inner planets being located in the bottom hemisphere suggests that the primary energy focus is inward and personal.
 – The emphasis on cardinal modes (notably with quick initiatory energies) is balanced by the subdued and internalized energy of retrograde Mars.

These factual observations provide a foundation for the objective interpretation of Stefan’s genuine internal dynamics with respect to his thoughts, feelings, and intentions. Further interpretative steps will draw upon these specific aspects and configurations without favoring any pre-assumed relational direction.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based solely on the chart data and after a detailed, objective evaluation, the following definitive relational signature emerges regarding Stefan’s true and genuine thoughts, feelings, and intentions:

• 7th House: Mars in Cancer, retrograde and in the house of partnerships, indicates that his assertive energies in personal connections are internalized. This suggests hesitancy, with an inclination toward internal conflict rather than bold outward action.

• Mars Aspects:
 – The trine between Mars and Saturn provides a stabilizing influence, suggesting some degree of self-discipline or reservation.
 – The square with Chiron highlights an underlying sensitivity or unresolved wound that colors his way of asserting himself.

• T-Square Configuration:
 – The T-Square involving the MC (28° Libra), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and IC (28° Aries) with participation from the Moon (4° Scorpio) illustrates a tension between his public image and inner emotional life. This dynamic points to significant internal friction that may cause his true feelings to be obscured or contradictory.

• Moon on the Midheaven:
 – The Moon’s placement on the Midheaven in Libra, along with its square to Pluto, underlines that his emotional expression is both intense and, at times, disruptive. This reflects a struggle between the desire to present a composed public face and the pull of deeper, more turbulent emotions.

• Communication Processes:
 – Mercury in Pisces, particularly given its supportive sextile with the Ascendant but challenging square with Jupiter, reveals that his thoughts are intuitive yet prone to exaggeration or misinterpretation. There is a potential for his inner narratives to be influenced by idealism or even self-deception.

• Venus and Idealism:
 – Venus in Aries in the 3rd House suggests that, when it comes to relational impulses, there is a spark of energetic and direct desire. However, its sign and house placement denote that this may not strictly be of a romantic nature but could also reflect a dynamic, sometimes impulsive drive to communicate or engage.
 – The conjunction of Neptune with the North Node in Pisces reinforces an idealistic, sometimes elusive vision of connection that may blur the boundary between genuine feelings and aspirational constructs.

• Cradle Pattern and Cardinal Emphasis:
 – The Cradle pattern, involving the Moon, Sun, Ascendant, and key angular points, indicates a structured support in his chart that moderates the otherwise turbulent energies. Still, the dominance of Cardinal energy among inner planets reinforces a strong need to initiate and direct action—albeit one that is currently inhibited by ongoing internal adjustments.

Overall, the chart presents Stefan as deeply conflicted: his internal drive and desire to connect are obstructed by defensive internalization and unresolved sensitivities. His thoughts seem preoccupied with an idealistic vision of connection that struggles to manifest in practical, externally assertive actions. The interplay between his public and private energies, as well as the marked influence of internal wounds, suggests that his intentions could be well-meaning yet frustrated by internal complexities.

 – Venus in Aries in the 3rd House suggests that, when it comes to relational impulses, there is a spark of energetic and direct desire. However, its sign and house placement denote that this may not strictly be of a romantic nature but could also reflect a dynamic, sometimes impulsive drive to communicate or engage.
 – The conjunction of Neptune with the North Node in Pisces reinforces an idealistic, sometimes elusive vision of connection that may blur the boundary between genuine feelings and aspirational constructs.

• Cradle Pattern and Cardinal Emphasis:
 – The Cradle pattern, involving the Moon, Sun, Ascendant, and key angular points, indicates a structured support in his chart that moderates the otherwise turbulent energies. Still, the dominance of Cardinal energy among inner planets reinforces a strong need to initiate and direct action—albeit one that is currently inhibited by ongoing internal adjustments.

Overall, the chart presents Stefan as deeply conflicted: his internal drive and desire to connect are obstructed by defensive internalization and unresolved sensitivities. His thoughts seem preoccupied with an idealistic vision of connection that struggles to manifest in practical, externally assertive actions. The interplay between his public and private energies, as well as the marked influence of internal wounds, suggests that his intentions could be well-meaning yet frustrated by internal complexities.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the objective analysis of the horary chart, the following observations are pertinent regarding Stefan's marital status:

• The 7th House of partnerships is represented by Cancer with only Mars present. Mars is retrograde in Cancer, which typically indicates internalized or conflicted relationship energy rather than the outward manifestation of a stable, established marital union.

• There is an absence of traditional marital markers in the 7th house. Often, a well-supported 7th house in matters of marriage would be signified by Venus, Jupiter, or other stable, positively aspected bodies. In this chart, however, the dominant focus is on internal tensions and unresolved issues (evidenced by Mars in squaring Chiron and the T-Square configuration).

• The overall configuration of the chart—showing significant internal conflict between public and personal energies—suggests that Stefan is in a state of internal deliberation regarding his approach to relationships. There is no clear indication of an external, formalized commitment such as marriage.

Conclusion: There is no clear or sufficient evidence from the provided horary chart to indicate that Stefan is currently married.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: He is married. Not to me. But he is married.  Can you please look at the chart again and see if there are any indicators that were missed and how we might be able to amend any directives so that they will be properly caught in future interpretations?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
A reexamination of the chart suggests that some indicators initially underweighted might imply an existing union. Revised observations include:

• 7th House Presence and Mars in Cancer (retrograde)
 – Although the 7th House governs committed partnerships, the sole presence of Mars (especially retrograde and in Cancer) can be read as conflicted or guarded energy that may serve to mask an established marriage rather than indicate its absence.
 – In cases of marital unions, the focus on internal struggles or unresolved issues may reflect an ongoing adjustment period within the marriage rather than a lack of union.

• T-Square Dynamics Involving Public versus Private Life
 – The T-Square constituted by the MC (28° Libra), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and the IC (28° Aries) suggests a pronounced dichotomy between how he presents himself publicly and his inner state.
 – The Moon’s involvement (4° Scorpio on the Midheaven) indicates that public visibility and social roles—including formal marital status—are strongly present, even if obscured by inner turmoil.

• Indicators in the 2nd and 3rd Houses
 – The 2nd House contains the Sun, Mercury, and Saturn in Aquarius; these placements denote personal stability and internal values that underpin long-term commitments.
 – The 3rd House houses Venus, Neptune, the North Node, and Chiron in Pisces/Aries, which may suggest that while his relational impulses and communication are active, they coexist with idealistic or wounded energies. This may provide a context where marital ties are present but complex.

• Revision of Analytical Directives
 – Future interpretations should explicitly consider that a lack of overtly supportive markers in the 7th House does not conclusively negate an existing marriage. In charts where noted difficulties (e.g., retrograde Mars, T-Square configurations) obscure clear indicators, additional emphasis should be placed on public (MC) and stability markers in the 2nd/3rd Houses.
 – When the subject is known to be married, directives must cross-check not only 7th House dynamics but also assess complementary evidence from angular relationships (e.g., Moon on the MC, aspects involving Saturn and Venus) that indicate an established commitment.
 – Documenting any validated marital status in future readings will require a weighted analysis of all supporting planetary placements—even if traditional marriage indicators within the 7th House appear conflicted.

These amendments ensure that future interpretations incorporate both overt and hidden markers indicative of marital union, reducing biases that might overlook established partnerships due to internal chart conflicts.
